value: 1) The article discusses actualism, the view that being is restricted to actual being, and possibilism, the view that being also includes possible entities.
2) The article discusses how actualists have proposed different strategies for different types of expressions in order to avoid the conclusion that these expressions are meaningless.
3) The article discusses truthmaker theory and how actualists have proposed various solutions to account for the truthmakers of modal truths.
4) The article discusses how actualists have proposed to view intentional attitudes not as relations between a subject and an object but as properties of the subject.
5) The article discusses how possibilists can interpret the intentional attitude as a relation between a subject and a possible object.
